data.title: Opening a file should ignore casing if file already opened (Win, Mac)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Insider Preview

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a file Foo.cpp. Have it open in a tab.
2. Run a task that emits a problem for "foo.cpp" instead of "Foo.cpp".
3. Double click the problem in the error pane.

Expected: Window switches to the Foo.cpp tab.

Actual: Window creates a new foo.cpp tab and switches to it. Foo.cpp is still open, too.

data.title: Using zsh theme for my terminal and I'm missing a font inconsolata for powerline
data.body:
- VSCode Version:newest
- OS Version:Ubuntu

I have zsh theme(cobalt2 from wesbos) and my theme looks incomplete with strange characters in certain points. I know why this is happening because I have no powerline fonts installed in the vscode integrated terminal. How do I add the  inconsolata for powerline font to vscode terminal.

I added a screen shot to illustrate whats going on...
![vscodeshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18559173/20071217/1d4d55ec-a4e9-11e6-820a-2f8b360420d5.png)
in my screenshot there should be an arrow at the end of the color indicator...

data.title: Extra spaces being added to JS files on copy/paste

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (d3f14897a3149f5982db31b52ba7edb254466b14, 2016-11-07T07:05:13.526Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.1.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.3.7|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.1.0|
|html-css-class-completion|Zignd|1.0.3|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.0.18|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.10.0|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.12.2|
|one-monokai|azemoh|0.1.15|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.1.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.0.8|
|tslint|eg2|0.5.40|
|auto-close-tag|formulahendry|0.3.4|
|auto-rename-tag|formulahendry|0.0.7|
|Angular1|johnpapa|0.1.16|
|theme-karyfoundation-themes|karyfoundation|7.4.0|
|vscode-stylefmt|mrmlnc|2.0.1|
|nonbreakingspace|smlombardi|0.0.1|
|stylelint|shinnn|0.18.1|
|theme-tesla|smlombardi|0.0.1|
|autoimport|steoates|1.2.2|
|bootstrap-3-snippets|wcwhitehead|0.0.8|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. put cursor in line to copy.  The line has no trailing spaces.
2. put cursor after line where you want to paste code.  hit return to make a new line.
3. paste. code wraps to next line, as expected
4. hit "delete" key until cursor moves back up to the prior (pasted) line, after the semicolon. You can see the cursor right up against the semicolon.
5. notice the semicolon has a red "error" squiggle. hovering says it's due to trailing spaces.
6. Drag cursor to the right of the semicolon, there are indeed spaces!

Where the heck did those come from??

![nov-07-2016 13-36-33](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/835148/20070847/0a75896a-a4f0-11e6-827d-d49ed0245cbc.gif)

data.title: Render Markdown of JSDoc
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: macOS

I'm expecting 

```ts
/**
 * This is foo
 * Foo is great! Use it like this:
 * 
 * ```ts
 * const foo = new Foo(); 
 * ```
 */
function Foo() {

}


var f = new Fo
```

I was expecting my Markdown to be rendered here: 

![screen shot 2016-11-07 at 10 35 41 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/543633/20070625/f73a3fb8-a4d5-11e6-93f2-393b0d057e2f.png)

data.title: This test delays test execution by 500ms
Add a CLI option to switch to fullscreen or maximize new or existing window
data.body:
- Feature request
Would like to have a CLI option to specify that any new instance/window is maximized/switched to fullscreen (depending on the OS). This would be convenient for a scenario in which (for macOS, for example) I want to launch from a shell script and have each window in its own space. (For macOS, I assume that the normally focused (last) instance will be switched to.)

If I can have an official opinion on what to call the CLI option, I'm happy to whip this up and do a PR.

Thanks!

data.title: Warning: "Cannot validate the php file. The php program was not found...."
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 8

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to File -> Preferences -> Workspace Settings
2. In the newly created settings.json enter the following line:

    `"php.validate.executablePath": "C:/PHP/php.exe"`

After I do that, I still get the following error:

    

> Cannot validate the php file. The php program was not found. Use the 'php.validate.executablePath' setting to configure the location of 'php'.

I've verified the location of the PHP executable by using the following command line:

> where php.exe

as well checking the value of system variable PHPRC.

Why is VS Code still not finding the PHP executable?

data.title: Network share issues
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
1.7.1
- OS Version:
Ubuntu 16.04

- Problem
Intermittent issue saving files on a network (samba / cifs) share. This share is between two PC's on the same internal network.

Now and again when saving a file it will pop up an error saying it could not save, it then pops up a notice saying file has changed on disk with option to compare

When comparing the "disk" version is empty. The save has cased saving a blank file.

Closing the file and reopen and I can continue saving and editing as per usual.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/94674/20066812/dc00aa04-a50a-11e6-86f9-46fcf3526594.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/94674/20066837/ead54c1a-a50a-11e6-948a-6542c6942aeb.png)

I have checked with `ls -al` when this happens and the file size is 0. As this has emptied the file, there is a real chance of losing work.

Today is the first day I have been using a network share and it has happened 3 times.

data.title: Consider changing the focus after staging a file

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:

Version 1.7.1
Commit 02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44
Date 2016-11-03T13:46:46.244Z
Shell 1.3.8
Renderer 52.0.2743.82
Node 6.5.0

- OS Version:
Ubuntu 16.04

After staging a file in the git view, focus the next file to be staged.

For my workflow, I'd want the next file in the list of stages to be the thing focused. Since I have a keyboard shortcut setup for staging a file, I could arrow up/down and use my shortcut to stage all files, without using a mouse or losing context. If the list of files to be staged creates a scrollbar, the context is lost after staging as it highlights/focuses the item that was just staged.

data.title: External file watcher fails for editors that do atomic saves
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: osx 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a file with random text.
2. Open it with vscode and TextEdit for example.
3. Edit the file in TextEdit and save it.
4. The file was refreshed in vscode.
5. Keep editing the file in TextEdit and save it.
6. vscode don't refresh the file only the first time, after that no more refresh occur.

side note: after editing the file in vscode and try to save it, and it shows a upper popup telling that the file has some diferences from the original and open a compare window.

data.title: --jsx flag in .tsx files, weird behavior
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.7.1 (1.7.1) / 02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44 - OS Version: OSX 10.11.6 Guys I just update vscode and someting very weird is going on. Before works alright. `tsconfig.json` ```javascript { "compilerOptions": { "outDir": "./public/", "sourceMap": true, "noImplicitAny": false, "module": "commonjs", "target": "es5", "jsx": "react" }, "files": [ "./typings/custom/sass.d.ts", "./client/index.tsx" ] } ``` this is a first file indicating that --jsx flag missing which is not true. `routes.tsx`: second file in same directory: `index.tsx`: this file is ok with jsx syntax.

data.title: VSCode is horribly slow to start on Windows 7 Enterprise 64-bit

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Pro SP1 64-bit

Hi there. I love VS code. Ironically it runs great on my Mac but is agonizingly slow on Win7.
Start time is approximately 2 minutes. Opening a file is instantaneous, but opening a folder = 2 minutes again.
I have tried running code --disable-extensions. Still 2 minutes.

My user profiles file looks like this:
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings
{
    
    "update.channel": "none",
    "files.exclude": {
        "**/largeFolder": true
    }

}

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start VS Code
2. Watch entire episode of Big Bang Theory
3. Start coding

data.title: Renaming symbol is broken
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:53:14.822Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.0.18|
|typings-installer|benjaminromano|0.2.0|
|jshint|dbaeumer|0.10.15|
|vscode-instant-markdown|dbankier|0.1.0|
|vscode-jasmine-es5|deerawan|1.0.1|
|Angular1|johnpapa|0.1.16|
|fuzzy-definitions|jrieken|0.0.3|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.4.1|
|Theme-1337|ms-vscode|0.1.2|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.2.0|
|todotasks|sandy081|0.4.0|
|vscode-open-in-github|sysoev|1.2.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open up a js file (in my case a file called `projectConnections.js`)
2. Right-click a variable and select Rename Symbol
3. Type something, click enter

Expected result:
The variable is changed in the same window/file where I did the change

Actual result:
A new file is opened containing the change. The filename of the new file is all in lowercase (`projectconnections.js`)

See clip here: http://recordit.co/kqkWTjicWU

data.title: Option to render proper scrollbar

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The current VS Code scrollbars (both vertical and horizontal) are OK, but I would prefer:
- The scrollbars not to disappear when the mouse stops moving
- The scrollbars to be a bit thicker, thus easier to click
- An up and a down arrow at the top and bottom (or left and right of the horizontal one) to scroll one line per click
- The scrollbar to jump "towards" where you click on empty space either side of the scroll handle, instead of the handle immediately jumping to where the mouse cursor is

In short, they should be like the Visual Studio 2015 scrollbars.  Maybe a setting could be introduced to render this more "traditional" type of scrollbar.

data.title: Display breakpoints in scrollbar

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: It would be nice to see at-a-glance where breakpoints have been set in a code file.  They could be displayed in red the scrollbar area, like "changed/added code lines" are currently shown in blue.

data.title: Next terminal is not focused when a shell process dies on its own (then terminalFocus doesn't act as expected)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.1 (16B2555)

Steps to Reproduce for "open":

1. Toggle terminal pane
2. Start a second terminal (via shortcut or click on '+')
3. Try using a set shortcut for workbench.action.terminal.focusNext / workbench.action.terminal.focusPrevious
4. At this point, the values of setting `terminal.integrated.commandsToSkipShell` get ignored, shortcuts don't work and the pressed key reaches the terminal
5. Toggling terminal pane twice to ensure that terminalFocus ist set and everything works as expected.


![terminal_1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7542/20062045/84328e30-a502-11e6-8f55-b7decee89ae9.gif)

Steps to Reproduces for "close":
1. Open a terminal pane with 2+ terminals
2. Close a terminal (by typing "exit" or "ctrl-d")
3. terminalFocus is is lost and shortcuts get send to the editor instead (shortcuts for switching terminals in the animated screenshot are set to the same as  next/previous tab)
4. Notice that the cursor in the terminal even shows that it has no focus - unlike in the first example, where the cursor stays the same!
5. Toggle terminal pane twice to make everything work again

![terminal_2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7542/20062271/6b05b03a-a503-11e6-8903-6cca7667bbec.gif)


PS: Yes, --disable-extensions was used ;)

data.title: Extensions Not Working Behind Corporate Proxy
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 (6.1.7601)

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Open VSCode
2.  Click on the extensions button on the left hand pane.
3.  I receive the below error in the developer console.

```js
messageService.ts:128 Cannot read property 'call' of undefined: TypeError: Cannot read property 'call' of undefined,    at 
e.onCommonRequest (c:\program files (x86)\microsoft vs code\resources\app\out\vs\code\node\sharedProcessMain.js:6:21919),    at 
e.onMessage (c:\program files (x86)\microsoft vs code\resources\app\out\vs\code\node\sharedProcessMain.js:6:21756),    at 
c:\program files (x86)\microsoft vs code\resources\app\out\vs\code\node\sharedProcessMain.js:6:21549,    at e.invoke (c:\program files (x86)\microsoft vs code\resources\app\out\vs\code\node\sharedProcessMain.js:4:26230),    at 
e.fire (c:\program files (x86)\microsoft vs code\resources\app\out\vs\code\node\sharedProcessMain.js:5:4113),    at 
c:\program files (x86)\microsoft vs code\resources\app\out\vs\code\node\sharedProcessMain.js:6:25696,    at e.invoke (c:\program files (x86)\microsoft vs code\resources\app\out\vs\code\node\sharedProcessMain.js:4:26230),    
at e.fire (c:\program files (x86)\microsoft vs code\resources\app\out\vs\code\node\sharedProcessMain.js:5:4113),    at 
Socket.i (c:\program files (x86)\microsoft vs code\resources\app\out\vs\code\node\sharedProcessMain.js:6:11865),    at 
emitOne `(events.js:96:13)`
```


Here is my settings.json.  As you can see I configure the proxy so all should work.
```javascript
{
    "http.proxy": "http://oproxy.example.com:8080",
    "https.proxy": "http://oproxy.example.com:8080",
    "http.proxyStrictSSL": false
}
```

data.title: Console process (yarn install) runs slower then in native console
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6
- OS Version: Windows 10

Noticed that `yarn install` process takes longer time in vscode console. Think this should be investigated.


Can be reproduced this way:

1.  install yarn package manager (`npm i yarn -g`)
2.  create package.json and add two dependencies:
```
    "babel-preset-es2015": "^6.6.0",
    "babel-preset-stage-0": "^6.5.0"
```
3. run `yarn` in this directory. 

Those modules have many internal dependencies and yarn install (Link dependencies state) takes quite a long time, so it can be compared running in native console and in vscode integrated terminal.

data.title: November/December Iteration Plan
data.body:
This plan captures what we work on during November and early December. This iteration will be 6 weeks long. This is unusually long for us. We are an internationally distributed team and everybody in the team wants to enjoy the forthcoming holiday season while we still continue working as a closely knit team. Thus, it's 6 weeks this time. We will ship **mid December**.

Not unusual and still noteworthy: We will do several explorations that might or might not result in concrete deliverables in this or later releases.

## Endgame Schedule
- *December, 5th* Code freeze for the endgame
- *December, 9th* Endgame done


##### Monday - 5th December
- [x] Code freeze at 5pm PT
- [x] Ensure we have a green build on all platforms
- [x] All test items contain sufficiently comprehensive test descriptions by 6pm PT

##### Tuesday - 6th December
- [x] Test build starts at 7am CET / 10pm PT on Monday
- [x] Test plan ready by 8am CET / 11pm PT on Monday
- [x] Testing

##### Wednesday - 7th December
- [x] Testing
- [x] Remind team members to assign issues that they intend to fix to the November milestone
- [x] Fixing (self-assigned, milestone assigned)
- [x] [Verification](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Issue-Tracking#verification) Since there are quite some old bugs to verify we verify by age, youngest first. The queries are:
  - [x] [Verification needed](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+-label%3Averified+is%3Aclosed+label%3Averification-needed)
  - [x] [November Bugs](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue%20label%3Abug%20-label%3Averified%20is%3Aclosed%20-label%3Aduplicate%20-label%3Ainvalid%20closed%3A%3E%3D2016-11-01%20-label%3Aas-designed)
About 80 issues were verified on 12/7

##### Thursday - 8th December
- [x] Remind team members to start add Release Notes
- [x] Fixing (scrutiny sets in - major bugs only - to be discussed in stand-up meeting, labeled as `candidate`)
- [x] [Verification](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Issue-Tracking#verification)
- [x] Add/update shrink-wrap files for built-in extensions if needed (see [instructions](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8570#issuecomment-229669456)) **@ramya-rao-a**
- [x] Update `OSSREADME.json` for built-in extensions based on differences to generated `npm-shrinkwrap.json` files if needed **@ramya-rao-a**
- [x] Run [OSS tool](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-distro/blob/master/distro-tools/README.md) after merging shrink-wrap findings **@ramya-rao-a**
  - *The LCA review of the ThirdPartyNotices.txt files is not needed anymore*
- [x] Check new OSS usage is entered into the [OSS registry](https://ossmsft.visualstudio.com/_apps/hub/ms.vss-oss-web.hub-oss) **@ramya-rao-a**

##### Friday - 9th December
- [x] Pause scheduled `insider` builds **@zurich**
- Satellite modules/npm packages ready, version updated, smoke tested
  - [x] vscode **@bpasero**
  - [x] yo generator **@aeschli**
  - [x] vsce **@joaomoreno**
  - [x] node debug **@weinand**
- [x] Translation input - **@dbaeumer**
- [x] Fixing (only critical bugs - no string changes)
- [Smoketest](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Smoke-Test)
  - [x] Windows - **@dbaeumer**
  - [x] OS X - **@weinand**
  - [x] Linux - **@sandy081**
- [x] All release notes updated. Release notes are collected in a file named *`Major_Minor.md`* in this [repo directory](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs/blob/vnext/release-notes/)
  - [x] @alexandrudima
  - [x] @weinand
  - [x] @chrmarti
  - [x] @tyriar

- [x] Sanity check of installable bits
  - [x] Windows
    - [x] signed installer **@mousetraps**

  - [x] Linux

    - [x] rpm package 64-bit **@rebornix**
    - [x] rpm package 32-bit **@rebornix**
    - [x] archives **@chrmarti**

##### Wednesday - 14th December
- [x] Publish website **@gregvanl**
- [x] Publish to stable **@kieferrm**
- [x] Add a git tag to `HEAD` of `release/<x.y>` in format `x.y.z` **@ramya-rao-a**
- [x] Enable scheduled `insider` builds **@kieferrm**
- [x] Twitter announcement **@seanmcbreen**

## Plan Items

Our team uses a [GitHub Project](https://github.com/orgs/Microsoft/projects/2) to track its work. GitHub does not support public Projects right now. Below is a summary of the top level plan items.

Legend for annotations:

| Mark  | Description |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| :runner: | work in progress  |
| :hand: | blocked task |
| :muscle: | stretch goal for this iteration  |
| :large_blue_circle: | more details required |
| :red_circle: | missing issue reference |

## Themes
- performance
- discoverability
- UI scalability
- API improvements
- accessibility testing


### Feedback

Issues to address community feedback:

- [x] Workbench - Finish 'Hot Exit' #101 @tyriar @bpasero
- [x] Workbench - Polish and evolve API and implementation of contributable explorers #14048 @jrieken @octref @__owner__
- [x] Workbench - Address UI scalability in the face of contributable explorers #15155 @stevencl @bgashler1 @bpasero
- [ ] Workbench - Improve discoverability of available functionality
   - [ ] Review command, panel, and widget names #15158 @seanmcbreen @chrmarti
   - [x] Add a 'Selection' menu #15156 @chrmarti
   - [x] Add entries to keymaps to Preferences menu #15159 @chrmarti
- [x] Editor - Improve accessibility of diff editor (do not only use color) #15371 @rebornix @alexandrudima
- [x] Editor - Sublime compatibility (see #3776)
   - [x] Prioritize missing Sublime keybindings @waderyan
   - [x] Implement top 3 of the missing keybindings @rebornix
- [x] Git - Add 'Clone from GitHub' to the command palette @joaomoreno
- [x] Debug - Improve UX for multi-target debugging #14450 @isidorn
- [x] Debug - Support more flexible handling of exceptions Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node#64 @weinand
- [x] Debug - Allow debug adapters to customize the behavior of the 'restart' button #14189 @weinand @isidorn
- [x] Debug - Add reverse continue for TimeTravel Debugging #13705 @weinand @isidorn
- [x] Debug - Support objects in debug console output #15796 @weinand @isidorn
- [x] Debug - Improve 'smart step' to support black-listing of modules/libraries #3215 @roblourens @weinand 
- [x] Debug - Allow to use external files to specify the environment of a launch config #14523 @weinand
- [x] Debug - Productize composite launch configs #14842 @weinand @isidorn
- [ ] Documentation - Describe our UX process for the team and the community @chrisdias
- [x] :muscle: Workbench - Use custom title on macOS #15098 @bpasero


### API Improvements for Extensions

- [x] API - Configuration service provides access to configuration scopes #10583 @jrieken
- [x] API - Add support for dynamic changes of capabilities to the language server protocol [LSP#125](https://github.com/Microsoft/language-server-protocol/issues/125) @dbaeumer
- [x] API - Allow language servers to provide command implementations [LSP#126](https://github.com/Microsoft/language-server-protocol/issues/126) @dbaeumer
- [ ] :muscle: API - Explore exposing the language server protocol as JSON schema rather than a `d.ts` file [LSP#25](https://github.com/Microsoft/language-server-protocol/issues/25) @dbaeumer
- [x] API - Allow code completion providers to return dynamically computed snippets using a subset of the TextMate snippet syntax #3210 @jrieken
- [x] API - Support variables in snippets #4956 @jrieken
- [x] API - Explore the use of status codes in rejected promises to communicate information back to the client #15454 @jrieken
   - [x] Code completion providers
   - [x] Find all references
   - [x] Go to definition
- [x] API - Use non-nullable types in `vscode.d.ts` #6907 @jrieken 
- [ ] :muscle: API - Use `readonly` modifier in `vscode.d.ts` #12732 @jrieken 
- [x] :muscle: Debug - Support snippets in 'launch.json' #13886 #15974 @isidorn @weinand


### Language support
- [x] JavaScript
   - [x] Clarify need of `jsconfig.json` for projects without commonjs modules [TS#11554](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/11554) @dbaeumer
   - [x] Remove `jsconfig.json` light bulb #15205 @mjbvz
   - [x] Improve large project warning - dependency on TS server sending a notification #15208 @mjbvz
   - [ ] :muscle: UX improvements for automated typings acquistion (adopt new status code API) #15209 @mjbvz @dbaeumer
   - [x] Explore the need for pre-seeding typings files #15536 @dbaeumer
- [x] TypeScript
   - [x] Explore with the TS team on Compile on Save support [TS#11526](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/11526) @dbaeumer
   - [x] Explore exposing code actions provided by the TS Server #15535 @dbaeumer & @mjbvz


### Debt Items

Issues to reduce our engineering debt:

- [x] Let `vscode-textmate` compute simplified tokens. This will improve rendering performance as well as fix issues we see with several textmate themes. #15379 @alexandrudima
- [x] Review themes in response to `vscode-textmate` changes #15376 @aeschli
- [ ] :muscle: Change emmet ownership @ramya-rao-a
   - [ ] Use #11679 as warm-up @ramya-rao-a
- [ ] :muscle: Improve Integrated Terminal on Windows by moving up to a newer version of winpty (part of ##13625) @tyriar
- [ ] :muscle: Use @types in our code rather than the old style typings files #14043 @dbaeumer
- [x] Port language server implementation to TS 2.0 #15201 @mjbvz
- [x] Debug - VS Code starts to use that information to fix the hover experience by only showing a hover when inside the scope boundaries. #15172 @isidorn


### Extension Contributions

Support/contribute to extensions:

- [x] All - Ensure all extensions we contribute to are using the extension change log @kieferrm
- [ ] :running: PHP - Continue exploration of improved PHP parser with symbol and location information #15818  @mousetraps
   - [ ] Discuss parser exploration with community
- [x] Go - Explore Go language server seeded by SourceGraph @ramya-rao-a
- [x] Azure - Explore Azure extension pack for the market place @chrisdias



### Engineering

This section lists several engineering/development items that the team identified:

- [x] Improve support for Javascript in HTMl #15377 @aeschli
   - [x] Ensure html language server is self-contained
   - [x] Explore possibility of providing an html language server library for easy adaptation to other scenarios
- [x] Improve workbench start-up performance #15455 @bpasero @jrieken
   - [x] Collect more detailed startup performance data and send it using the existing start-up time event
   - [x] Investigate need for log service
- [x] Workbench - Investigate return to open on mouse-down #15819 @bpasero
- [ ] Quick Open - Invesigate the costs of persisting our file cache #15382 @chrmarti
- [x] File Search - Improve performance of file search #15384 @chrmarti @roblourens
   - [ ] Ensure we understand usage patters of file search
- [x] Understand extension host reliability #15456 @jrieken
- [x] Adopt extension marketplace's CDN changes #15557 @joaomoreno
- [ ] :muscle: Investigate automating our smoke test @aeschli


### Feedback Channels

- [ ] Crash data (see also https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/7474) @ramya-rao-a
   - [x] #15375 Investigate possible sceanrios that can get crashes reported without metadata
   - [ ] #15754 Add crash details to the crash web site
- [x] Improve error telemetry @ramya-rao-a
   - [x] #12694 Fix broken stack traces in macOS and Linux
   - [x] #15483 Update error telemetry website to add links to source code from deminified call stack
   - [x] #13864 Error telemetry: sort by machines by default
   - [x] #15603 Update error telemetry site to add callstacks as comments to existing issues
   - [x] #15374 Fix errors coming from processes spawned by extensions that may have PII
   - [x] #15752 Always start to de-minify stack traces
- [ ] Data pipeline maintenance @ramya-rao-a
   - [ ]  Rename KPIs, add Weekly Avg KPI and backfill
   - [ ] Improve support for retention and churn data


### Explorations

We are continuously exploring options and ideas. Some might make it into future releases.

- [ ] :running: API - Explore potential support for SCM providers #15246 @joaomoreno
- [ ] Workbench - Explore improvements to settings #15162 @sandy081
   - [x] Improve adjustment of common settings
   - [x] Make it easier to find the settings that need adjustment and to adjust them
- [ ] Workbench - Improve experience for first time users #15383 @chrmarti @sandy081
   - [x] What adjustments are typically made on first run
   - [x] Familiarizing a first time user with VS Code
   - [x] How do we know we improved?
- [ ] :running: Tasks - Explore future direction of task support #15179 @dbaeumer
- [x] Debug - Explore how extension should participate in launching the debug adapers #8645 @weinand
- [x] Debug - Explore how extensions can contribute and implement custom actions #15656 #15657 @isidorn @weinand
- [ ] :running: Explore what it takes to ship VS Code as a UWP application #15820 @bpasero 
- [ ] :muscle: Explore code commenting support in diff editor for allowing a 'Review Github PR' extension #15380 @alexandrudima

data.title: Mac: allow for more custom title bar styles
data.body:
On Mac OS, modern applications typically take over control of the title bar. Some examples:

**Skype for Business:**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/20060897/a4fb35ae-a4fd-11e6-8f0c-5960a9e99d5f.png)

**Outlook:** 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/20060909/aeec297e-a4fd-11e6-81ea-5ff7084690b4.png)

VS Code so far is not leveraging this and thus the title appears like this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/20060963/f6146f78-a4fd-11e6-83f9-2632c77097c3.png)

Proposed solution introduces a new setting `window.titleBarStyle` that allows to switch to a custom title bar (and potentially also to a inline style as discussed in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/12628).

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/20060949/eded5dfa-a4fd-11e6-9a6a-936d32ae9e97.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/20060944/e7fd1e94-a4fd-11e6-8acc-1ef154c5c531.png)

data.title: VSCode doesn't watch for tsconfig.json
Same, same but different completions
data.body: * open an empty `package.json` files * trigger intellisense * you get two completions (one from vscode.javascript and one from vscode.json). Both are equal but one escapes the snippet syntax

data.title: Code snippets and other suggestions stop working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Sometimes on creating a new file, code snippets, and other suggestions refuse to work.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create new file within VSCode
2. Try to use code snippet, or anything to get suggestions up

data.title: Windows: task list not updated until doing a full restart
data.body: Today you have to do a full restart before the list of recently opened folders is updated. Instead we should update the task list when a folder is opened directly.

data.title: Apt/Yum repositories for Linux users
data.body:
VSCode is provided as .deb and .rpm packages for Linux users, but these are only provided as a stand-alone download, rather than from a repository.

Since VSCode updates often, having to manually download the new package and install it every time gets very old very fast. I notice that Windows users do get automatic updates which significantly improves the user experience.

It would be very much appreciated if VSCode updates were provided via repositories, rather than just as stand-alone downloads.

data.title: Ability to create simple macros
data.body:
It would be nice to be able to create some kind of simple "macros" which initially could be only a set of commands running together on a specified keyboard shortcut.

Example: **F5 - Start Debug**
* View -> Debug
* View -> Debug Console
* Start Debugging
